title.label: I played Banner Saga 1 three times

content.label: The first time I played I couldn't import my game into Banner Saga 2. The second time I played, I did it over the course of a weekend in an attempt to start Banner Saga 2 right after.  Seeing that Banner Saga 2 was just as challenging, if not more challenging, than the first game, I put it down.  I just picked up Banner Saga 1 and played through it a third time, so that I could maintain story cohesion for Banner Saga 2.  I'm glad I did!!  Banner Saga 2 was very epic in a lot of new ways, while maintaining all of the really cool features of the first: nail-biting strategy RPG battles, nail-biting Oregon Trail choice making, a KILLER musical score, and beautiful art. I will probably play Banner Saga 2 a second time in anticipation of playing the third.  Thank you for this beautiful RPG, very exciting and memorable! update: 11/19/20 I played BS2... two more times! I also bought BS1 and BS2 for PS4 and Switch. will there ever be an iOS port of BS3?

title.label: Hopefully adding Chinese language option in the future

content.label: Great strategic combat experience but the language can be a huge barrier since the choices that you make during the story mode determines what characters and amount resources you are going to get.  Thanks for reading my comment!

title.label: Banner saga 2 the kind of game we need

content.label: While playing banner saga I was gripped by the Great at style and I‚Äôm Evers I‚Äôve story that I feel many games lack I hope that stoic makes another banner saga game one day

I **really** loved banner saga 1 - 5*. However I played it about 4 years ago, and clearly some things have changed in BS2, notably around save and load mechanics.

First, I get to a battle which is utterly unwinnable.  Not ‚Äúhard‚Äù but ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù. This is bad enough.  (some woman we picked up who then ambushes you in the snow. You have no choice of characters. it assigns 3 rubbish level 1 characters to your party who are always eliminated on turn 1, no turn order, and the tactical situation is impossible. 

I consider myself pretty good - I have never lost a battle, never had to jump out, and I play on hard mode; but his battle is a joke. 

7 times I failed, so I decided to back up and load a previous save. Since you can‚Äôt control the saves, the ‚Äúmost recent‚Äù was several hours of play time back as I found when I opened the save. Seeing this I decided to abandon this course, and simply accept a defeat and move on.I went to load my ‚Äúprevious‚Äù save (the point before the terrible battle) only to find this no longer existed and the latest save was moments after the older one ‚Äî thus losing me hours of real time and results of several battles.

Bottom line : unwinnable battles pretty poor, inability to ‚Äúsave‚Äù is a deal breaker. Don‚Äôt start this game unless you like to be frustrated.

Oh, and final nail : BS 3 won‚Äôt come out on iOS  so it is a bit like a tv programme you enjoy that has had its last season cancelled on a cliff hanger. Don‚Äôt make the investment.

If there was a ‚Äúsave‚Äù button
These games are so amazing. You‚Äôve done a wonderful job with both of them. It‚Äôs been a while so, where is part 3?!

title.label: Buy the series games right away

content.label: Buy the series games like I said. Some of the best money you will spend on games period. Play the first game first. Well duh.... but these games are great. Waiting for the third installment to come to ios. Amazing stories. Fights. Choices. Character development forced and chosen. Sigh. More games like this please! They did so well that I love the back ground noise and music it makes it so immersive. You will know what I mean. This is a gaming company that truly cares about the platform and the game it puts out. From a customer thank you.
Never reviewed a game but this is worth playing involved turned the tv off edge of the seat kind of thing great game can‚Äôt say it enough...!!!!

title.label: Very enjoyable game, but you cannot finish the story...

content.label:
This is a wonderfully engaging game with a great story, fun gameplay, wonderful music, and beautiful art. I really enjoyed the different ways you can develop your characters, the different strategic requirements of the battles, and most of all, the really engaging story. It isn‚Äôt often that you see a game where the decisions really matter and you have so much freedom to find your way through a story. 

HOWEVER, the studio (Stoic) has not ported Banner Saga 3 to mobile, and appears uninterested in doing so, which means that I‚Äôm not able to finish the story I invested so many hours in. I‚Äôm very disappointed in the studio. This game, along with its predecessor, are the first video games to get my attention in a long, long time, and its really upsetting that Stoic seems to not realize or not care that there are people who play these games on their mobile devices and are unable to play them otherwise. Hopefully they will come around to porting #3 sooner or later, but until then, I can‚Äôt recommend getting invested in this or the first installment. Two stars because it‚Äôs such a fantastic game, but ultimately, a real letdown.

title.label: Favorite game but something glitchy with imports

content.label:
I have replayed the game probably twice per installation per year. 

One thing that‚Äôs confusing is the name of import saves from BS1 to BS2 is confusing and feels switched. Like I just imported my save from playing through as Rook and choosing to sacrifice Alette, but the import save is labeled as Alette. Only way I would‚Äôve known that the saved game will load as Rook was trying to remember what day I started playing which save. 

üò∞

I really love the lore, and the story building and tough choices to make, And growing up mostly focused on art classes I absolutely loved the art work and way its implemented, I really hope Banner Saga 3 comes to iOS because I really want to continue my story badly!!!

Looking forward to playing the continuation, and my gosh you also made the 3rd part for every other system but the mobile device!? Hope to see the conclusion, and whatever future projects Stoic works on in the future =)

Do not miss out on this gaming experience, they don‚Äôt come along nearly often enough.  The story is like a book you can‚Äôt put down, the choices incredibly well thought out, rarely black and white with characters drawn so vividly caring about the outcome is all but compulsory.  The gameplay is satisfying with balanced mechanics and  at first glance  simple yet fun turn based combat easy to grasp while  masking a  much deeper strategic and tactical system underneath allowing clever use of synergies, positioning, unique class abilities and more, giving you plenty to dig into and master.

It builds and improves on its predecessor, fine tuning  gameplay, adding classes and including additional features like destructible physical barricades and an addition I particularly enjoyed- optional training combat scenarios that teach how new abilities work and can best be utilized while rewarding the ever  needed resource termed ‚Äúrenown‚Äù.  Speaking of which the resource system is simple, but brilliant. Do you spend renown on supplies to keep your people from starving and dying, spend it to level up your heroes or purchasing gear/items.  And managing that balance of resource is crucial.

I can‚Äôt recommend this Saga enough and have pestered, cajoled, pressured  friend after friend to get it/play it and not one has been disappointed.  Writing a review for a game I enjoy is quite rare; but a game like this- I had too.  Don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve written a review since divinity2 or witcher3.  

The only real complaint is wanting more!!! More story more game more everything and luckily I still have the concluding entry of the trilogy to look forward to, banner saga 3.

To anyone reading and considering. You are in for a treat.  And if you have the option play on iPad over iPhone.  The extra screen size is ideal.

So good. The story is excellent and i enjoyed playing the first two so much! Theres minimal bugs, and the minor bugs can be easily forgiven by the gameplay. but.. WHERE IS BANNER SAGA 3!! Its been released on steam and other places, but its not on ios yet!

**banner saga 3 has been released on all other platforms since July of 2018

The artwork and music in this game are breathtaking, as has been notes in many other places. I love many things about the gameplay, such as the well designed and creative abilities and synergies between the heroes. I played through the Mac version of the first game on the computer and I‚Äôm halfway through the second on mobile.

The reason for 4/5 is I keep finding myself wanting certains small changes for conveying information during combat (that wouldn‚Äôt change gameplay at all, but make it easier / more convenient to get all the information about what is happening).
Specifically: 1) I mostly use the show all armor / strength display in the top right to get an overview of strong enemies still left on the field. It would be a really helpful thing to do something like add a red outline around the displayed armor / str of enemies to more easily sort through the information at a glance, when there are many units clumped together; currently the display is the same for your own units and enemies, making it quite confusing in the case of many units bunched together. This feels like such an obvious small touch that I‚Äôm surprised it‚Äôs missing given the attention to small details through the whole game as a whole. 
2) The biggest lack I feel is the ability to quickly ascertain enemy turn order. In order to figure out the enemy‚Äôs turn order you have to click through each portrait, see where they are on the board, then use the clunky armor / str display to see how much damage the enemies can do etc. If there are more enemies than fit in the queue, tough luck. The game mechanics of this game are very similar to Into the Breach (the biggest difference being the fact that each side gets a turn with all their units in that other game) and I would love to have a button like Into the Breach does for a quick overview of enemy turn orders: when you press it, it shows numbers next to each enemy unit, 1 for the next enemy unit in the queue, 2 for the one after etc

Anyway, great job with the game! Even though I mostly focused on what I wish the game implemented, it‚Äôs still a work of art and wonderful design. It‚Äôs effective at creating a real atmosphere, and the ending of the first game made me cry :*) Perhaps someone has made mods to the pc version with my desired features, Imay have to look into that :)
As a fan of Norse lore, this game really hits home with me.  Both a masterpiece of gameplay and storyline.

title.label: Good, but a step down from the 1st one

content.label: I enjoyed the game and don‚Äôt regret my purchase. The soundtrack, as with the first Banner Saga, is amazing. I continue to love the hand-drawn art and the unique setting. But the writing took a big step backward in the sequel. I was mostly satisfied with the content of the story, but the style of the writing was sometimes flippant, cheesy and generally much less mature than the first one. I‚Äôll be purchasing the third as soon as it is released on iOS because I do feel attached to seeing how the story ends. But I hope the quality is back to the standards of the first one.

I‚Äôve never played a game like this. It was incredible and worth every penny. Hours and hours of play, gripping story; I‚Äôve played it and Banner Saga 1 twice already and am starting a new game after this review. Wow. Buy this, play this, and cancel your plans for the day; you won‚Äôt be able to stop. When does Banner Saga 3 come out??? Hurry please. üòú

All heart here. I mean yeah, it‚Äôs not Squaresoft but it‚Äôs about the best indie strategy game I‚Äôve seen. I caught the Robert Jordan influence btw. ;)

Just wish it was longer. ::sigh:;

The sequel to The Banner Saga is tactically deeper, with improved battle variety, more character types, and more character abilities.
The story is just as rich and darkly moving as the first.
The art is still spectacular.
This is a must if you enjoyed the original.

There is a bug that is totally screwing up Banner Sags 2. Often when I‚Äôm in a battle the view somehow changes when I pinch the screen and gets stuck for the remainder of the battle. When this happens I can‚Äôt hit objects out of that view or even see any actions taking place off view. This essentially ruins the battle and is really awful. Please fix! 

Thanks,
Yofrez

Do you plan to make banner saga 3 available on mobile? It‚Äôs best platform is on mobile I do own this on pc as well but find it more tedious. Really really love your product. Please make more games like this
I played both regular and survival mode.  The artwork is great and I like the strategic form of battle.  Well worth the $$$.
Eagerly awaiting the chance to own the complete trilogy on my ipad, will be a day 1 purchase once it finally hits the app store. Here's hoping for Q1 2019 :)

title.label: The best series of games in the App Store

content.label: The Banner Saga 1 and 2 are definitely my favorite games I‚Äôve ever played on the App Store. The story, characters, artwork, and gameplay are all absolutely incredible. You will not regret buying these two games. I just really wish The Banner Saga 3 would come out on mobile! Please put it out soon!

I played Banner 1 and Factions a while back and loved them. Banner 2 is the perfect sequel to the first game. Recommended for anyone who loves a rich and intricate story, beautiful artwork, and engaging and thoughtful gameplay.
Inspiring story and beautifully strategic!

The text size is so tiny on the iphone that it looks like ants on the screen. 

And this is even with the big iphone, the "plus" size.  

I've had the game on the phone for a year, but I have never been able to play it.    I saw an update for the game that was supposed to address the font size, but it seems like nothing has changed.  

I can't imagine anyone playing it on the regular size phone.  

How do they bother to release this game without testing it first?   How can they sell it for the iphone without it being playable?

If you want to get screwed over and you have an iphone, then go ahead and buy this game.

======== Update =======
I got a new phone and thought I would try the game again ‚Äî a couple of years should be long enough for them to fix the tiny text issue right?  I am now on an 8 plus, up from the 6s plus phone. 

Nope ‚Äî some of the text is still at 1 and 2 point font.    Even after all this time.

title.label: One Of The Greatest Games I‚Äôve Ever Played

content.label: I can‚Äôt even begin to express my love for this game and the series in general. I‚Äôm usually a cheap-skate and won‚Äôt spend much money, if ANY on games, but I didn‚Äôt even hesitate to purchase this game. The combat is amazing, and the story itself is phenomenal. I loved this game so much that I even purchased the survival mode expansion. I love this game so much, and I can‚Äôt wait for the third game to come out.

title.label: Great game with no hidden costs

content.label: Great depth and challenging turned based strategy game. The price you pay is the only expense. Unlike most games today that hit you up for more bucks repeatedly to advance character or weapons or  play further chapters, there are no IN AP purchases. Great value for the purchase price. Strongly recommended. Also by buying, you support games that don‚Äôt rip you off!
Def getting the third when it‚Äôs out.
Good game on iPad. But still no iPhone X support :(

These games have blown me away, particularly with the top-notch world-building. As someone who always loved to pour over maps of Middle-Earth, Westeros, and Malazan the interactive map feature is easily my favorite thing about the game, just continuing to astonish me with how much thought has been put into the creation of the world. Five stars easily, and I wish I could give you more helpful feedback but I just cannot find any flaws in Banner Saga or its sequel. I do no normally follow specific game developers but I have not enjoyed a game this much since The Last of Us. Looking forward to the finale and keep up the great work! Skold!

As it stands right now, this is so buggy I'm not even able to re-download it to test it again. Both games would end up crashing at some point into the game leaving me to constantly try and go to an earlier save and see if I could figure out what was causing it to crash. The game is incredible, yes just as everyone says but with one caveat it's definitely not optimized for mobile. On the desktop or laptop you can "fix" the problems the game gets itself into, probably clobbers over its own memory with pointer issues who knows but the game is literally unplayable on mobile and that's just sad.

Love this game, considering buying the trilogy for xbone when it comes out, but I‚Äôve got kids so console gaming is rare these days. If you were debating getting, just do it and thank me later, obviously buy bs1 first!

Play the original game first. This game is even better. Good improvements and better tutorials. Can‚Äôt wait for the final installment. I just purchased survival mode. Thumbs up from me. 
Only thing is the need to update it for iPhone X. It‚Äôs difficult to read the dialogue at times. Thanks.

title.label: It‚Äôs a graphic novel with some game elements

content.label: It‚Äôs important to know going-in that this is primarily an interactive graphic novel. A good one. The strategic game comes in the form of occasional turn-based combat - which is also well done. Overall, a lot of fun. I love the artwork.

Superbly crafted. With lots of interesting characters and backstories, and a very cool and beautifully made world. Even the tactical tile based battling, which I'm not usually a fan of, is so much better than any other of its kind I‚Äôve tried and I‚Äôm thoroughly enjoying it along with all other aspects of the game. Love the difficulty too and I‚Äôm only playing on normal so far. This game has everything you could want. Easily the best mobile game I‚Äôve ever played.

I love the idea of the game, but it crashes once every few minutes for me. Occasionally I finish a battle without a crash, but usually I need to go back and make decisions and hear conversations two or three times before making progress in the game. 

I‚Äôve got an iPhone 8 Plus with over 200 GB of free space, so I‚Äôm not sure what the possible excuse could be.

UPDATE: I adjusted my UI settings slightly, and while I‚Äôm not sure why a brand new phone would have trouble with the game, it hasn‚Äôt crashed since.

title.label: Excellent Game; Great Story where decisions matter.

content.label: If you enjoy and good story, and love turned based battles. This game is for you. No it‚Äôs not a 3D mega game, but that‚Äôs part of the charm of this masterpiece. This was my first strategic rpg if this kind. I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôll ever find a game that tops it. Maybe banner saga 3?!?

This is the single greatest app I have ever bought. Beautiful artwork, amazing music, and a deep, rich compelling story. This game not only succeeds in continuing a great series (or should I say saga) but outdoes it‚Äôs predecessor in every way. I was left desperate for more by the games end, and could easily play the whole thing again.

Just as great as the first one. Beautiful art, music, characters, and interesting story. The only problem I have is a couple of the fights are ridiculously hard even on easy mode. The one under the mountain is really difficult and glitches in a couple spots where the characters can‚Äôt move. I had to replay that fight at least 10 times. Another hard fight is later on the bridge. I had such a difficult time with it, I had to put the game away for a month before I wanted to try again. And the ending was a little less satisfying than last time. Still great but definitely left me surprised that was where it ended.
So much fun! Artwork just as beautiful as BS1 also!
They literally took the PC version made for a mouse and changed it to tap. The text is too small to read. The buttons in battle are too close to each other. I would buy the PC version.
I‚Äôve been missing Galdius (killed 2 of my ps2‚Äôs lol) and needed a turned based fix. This met and exceeded my expectations! Bravo, and thank you!

title.label: Great game, but overshadowed by predecessor

content.label: From the animated cutscenes to the strategic gameplay, this is one of the very best games for IOS. I recommend everyone with iPhone 6 or later get this game. Loved the multiple characters this time! Reason for 4 stars? Ending, less animated cutscenes than first game, and story just wasn't quite as good. Still pretty good, but just something missing... That being said, I will most definitely be buying Banner Saga 3. Keep up the great work guys!
Loved this game can't wait for the sequel

The Banner Saga 2 is the best kind of sequel. It‚Äôs the kind that takes all of the best parts of the first game and refines them to make it better. It adds new character and gameplay that keep the game fresh and fun. 

I was originally disappointed that I missed the Picking up BS2 when it was on sale for 4.99. But even though I paid full price for the game ($9.99) it is still worth every penny. 

If you have played this game on a different platform I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs a Great experience. But if you want the best gameplay experience IOS is the way to go. 

I cannot wait to see how Stoic wraps up this epic saga.

title.label: ‚ÄúNo plans to update to iPhone X resolution‚Äù

content.label:
I wrote to Banner Saga 2‚Äôs support team regarding the game being updated to support the iPhone X screen. Here is their response:

(In short, no plans to update and I‚Äôm not sure their support team even understands the question....)

‚ÄúWe hope to adjust the resolution for iOS X in the future, but are currently working on Banner Saga 3 as our priority. We do not yet have this work planned out.

You can try changing the settings for the game in the Settings App in the meantime, I hope this helps!‚Äù

...really disappointing response.
I haven‚Äôt played BS1 and don‚Äôt normally play RPGs, but I tried this out & im hooked. Gameplay is easy to understand. The art & writing are fantastic.

title.label: Fire emblem and oregon trail had a baby.

content.label: And its a beautiful one. Its atmospheric, fun,and so engrossing to play. This is a tactical strategy with an intiguing backstory.
